definition: lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
surname Niu
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
classifier for houses or buildings/ridgepole (old)

sentences.english: He had never dreamed that the fund of human knowledge bulked so big.
sentences.chinese: 他从没想到人类知识的积蓄竟会如此汗牛充栋。

sentences.english: There are tons of studies about Song Xue before, with different views.
sentences.chinese: 以往的宋学研究成果，汗牛充栋，讨论角度各有不同。

sentences.english: Astronomy and geography anything, Expo Group, a voluminous.
sentences.chinese: 天文地理无所不看，博览群书，汗牛充栋。

sentences.english: The long and winding history of art brought along numerous - isms .
sentences.chinese: 艺术史的延绵更替造就了太多汗牛充栋的主义。

sentences.english: All previous dynasties scholar to "Poetry" research huge collection of books , too numerous to cite individually.
sentences.chinese: 历代学者对《诗经》的研究可谓汗牛充栋，不胜枚举。

definition: a huge amount (of books and papers)
vast as the open sea (idiom); fig. extensive (library)
at all times and in all places (idiom)
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
to afford a magnificent sight (idiom)/enchanting
lit. so numerous that one could just bend down and pick them up (idiom)/fig. extremely common/easily available
writing/to write/to compile
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
treatise/study
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
to write/literary work/book/article/writings/CL:部[bu4]
(of a piece of writing) long and tedious (idiom)/verbose
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
(of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
see 俯拾皆是[fu3 shi2 jie1 shi4]
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
